pullRequest.body:
This is the projective version of #13060 and is completely analogous to the current Jacobian file.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### PR summary [d3c94e47b7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14210/commits/d3c94e47b7239189d098f1d17f11775d34243f4f)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Projective | 1242 | 1243 | +1 (+0.08%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.EllipticCurve.Projective`|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ WeierstrassCurve.toProjective`
`+ X_eq_iff`
`+ X_eq_of_equiv`
`+ X_eq_zero_of_Z_eq_zero`
`+ Y_eq_iff`
`+ Y_eq_of_equiv`
`+ Y_ne_zero_of_Z_eq_zero`
`+ Z_eq_zero_of_equiv`
`+ comp_fin3`
`+ equation_of_Z_eq_zero`
`+ equation_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ equation_of_equiv`
`+ equation_smul`
`+ equiv_iff_eq_of_Z_eq`
`+ equiv_iff_eq_of_Z_eq'`
`+ equiv_of_X_eq_of_Y_eq`
`+ eval_polynomialX_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ eval_polynomialY_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ eval_polynomial_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ fin3_def_ext`
`+ isUnit_Y_of_Z_eq_zero`
`+ nonsingular_iff_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ nonsingular_of_Z_eq_zero`
`+ nonsingular_of_Z_ne_zero`
`+ nonsingular_smul`
`+ not_equiv_of_X_ne`
`+ not_equiv_of_Y_ne`
`+ not_equiv_of_Z_eq_zero_left`
`+ not_equiv_of_Z_eq_zero_right`
`+ smul_eq`
`+ smul_equiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Can you add a comment in the first message of the PR saying "This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing Algebraic Geometry" in June 2024." if this is true?

> Can you add a comment in the first message of the PR saying "This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing Algebraic Geometry" in June 2024." if this is true?

No, this is written independently and out of the working hours of AIM, but I will add this to #14130

This diff is a bit scary. Can you comment on what happened to
```
- equation_smul_iff
- nonsingularLift_zero'
- nonsingular_affine_of_Z_ne_zero
- nonsingular_iff_affine_of_Z_ne_zero
- nonsingular_of_affine_of_Z_ne_zero
- nonsingular_smul_iff
- nonsingular_zero'
```
?

The big diff shouldn't be too scary, as I'm merely copying over the changes I did for `Jacobian`.

- `equation_smul_iff` and `nonsingular_smul_iff`: renamed to `equation_smul` and `nonsingular_smul`
- `nonsingular_zero'` and `nonsingularLift_zero'`: I think these are not necessary given that we have `nonsingular_zero` `nonsingularLift_zero`
- `nonsingular_affine_of_Z_ne_zero`, `nonsingular_iff_affine_of_Z_ne_zero`, and `nonsingular_of_affine_of_Z_ne_zero`: combined to `nonsingular_of_Z_ne_zero`
Any reason not to add the deprecated aliases for any removed lemmas?

> Any reason not to add the deprecated aliases for any removed lemmas?

These are recent additions and I'm 100% sure this has not been used anywhere (because the API was unusable).
Thanks! This looks good to go. Even if we believe there are no downstream users, we want to be careful and add deprecations. Can you add deprecated aliases for the removed declarations?

I have read the deprecation policy in Zulip, but I'm still unconvinced that there is any point in adding the deprecrated aliases. This is a leaf file at the bottom of the import tree, and as I said the API was unusable prior to this and the four downstream PRs (#9417 #9418 #9420 #8485). There's nothing to be careful about, and adding the aliases is just extra clutter. The changes made in the [identical PR for Jacobian coordinates](#13060) was around the same time, and there were no aliases added for those.

Thanks. I know it may seem like no one else is paying attention to this code outside of mathlib members but mathlib has been used in some surprising ways and that is only going to keep increasing. 

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10583396304/job/29325334218)

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10583816009/job/29326658168)

Let's try again

bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10627908610/job/29461802526)

bors r-
Can you merge master, fix the lint, and then send it back to bors?
bors d+

:v: Multramate can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
Canceled.
bors r+
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10635154956/job/29484121596)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10635154956/job/29484122624)
This looks fine to me.
This looks fine to me.
I think `nonsingular_zero'` and `nonsingularLift_zero'` are worth keeping, otherwise LGTM

I'm not really clear about what this `TODO` means. If the base isn't a field then P isn't a point, it's a section, so "point...is nonsingular" perhaps does not even make sense. Anyway, I think the TODO probably shouldn't be in the docstring. Presumably the candidate replacement definition for commutative rings is that the ideal generated by the three eval's is the full ring, but I'm not entirely sure what this represents.

I'm mirroring #13060 so I'd have to change both in this PR if you prefer.

I don't think this is too important because I'll change it to the "candidate replacement definition" once the chain of Projective PRs are all merged, but they have been sitting around for a while.

```suggestion
notation `![x, y, z]`. However, `P` is not definitionally equivalent to the expanded vector
`![P x, P y, P z]`, so the lemmas `fin3_def` and `fin3_def_ext` can be used to convert between the
two forms. The equivalence of two point representatives `P` and `Q` is implemented as an equivalence
of orbits of the action of `Rˣ`, or equivalently that there is some unit `u` of `R` such that
`P = u • Q`. However, `u • Q` is not definitionally equal to `![u * Q x, u * Q y, u * Q z]`, so the
lemmas `smul_fin3` and `smul_fin3_ext` can be used to convert between the two forms.
```
right?

Sure, but not being syntactically equal implies not being definitionally equal, so this is still technically correct. I think `u • Q` is definitionally equal to `![u * Q x, u * Q y, u * Q z]` (since the proof is `rfl`) but not syntactically equal.

I'm mirroring https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13060 so I'd have to change both in this PR if you prefer.
The proof is `List.ofFn_inj.mp rfl` not rfl. It's different from the Jacobian case since the scalar multiplication here is the general one for any function, not necessarily a 3-tuple.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/Projective): add API for equations and nonsingularity
